title: Infinity Castle: Early Signal
logline: Inside Infinity Castle, a teenage Intruder decodes rhythm traps as a metaphor for hidden brain pathology and proves that early contrast MRI can expose dangerous inflow before collapse, turning fear into timely action.
theme: Early detection changes outcomes: when rhythm feels wrong, timely MRI and specialist review restore choice.

lines.text: A shamisen string rings through warm lantern air, and Infinity Castle corridors shiver in one clean pulse.
A 16-year-old unmasked Intruder jolts awake on tatami as if dropped into a dream, staring at endless sliding doors with no clear up or down.
Where am I... and why does the room move on sound?
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: She enters a long tatami corridor; each pluck tilts the axis, yet she recovers while everyone around her is thrown sideways.
Doors on both sides slide open in sequence, revealing dense groups of Hydrogen Crowd people jerking, stumbling, and regaining balance in repeating waves.
Too many of them. One beat moves all of them.
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: In the Glass Water Chamber, divers drift behind glass and recover slowly after each pluck, mirroring long-T1 water behavior.
In the Sumo Tatami Ring, massive wrestlers sway and rebound first on each beat, mirroring short-T1 fat recovery.
At the Bone Pillar Gallery, athletic tai chi monks and buddhist practitioners rotate around a fixed support pillar while each pluck challenges their balance.
Why do they keep turning in circles?
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: Because spins precess around one field axis before they realign.
lines.speaker: Castle String

lines.text: Intruder does not stop in any room; she scans faces and follows higher-energy hydrogen clusters being pulled in one direction.
Crowd streams merge into a single human current flowing toward a bright tatami stage where more groups keep arriving every beat.
On the Geisha Resource Dais, a breathtaking Geisha (Lure) lifts her fan to the pluck, and the crowd gives her one obedient step of energy.
T1 is recovery time after the pulse. Fat returns fast, water returns slow; reading these differences early buys time.
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: The Geisha (Lure) smiles and opens the circle for Intruder, expecting one more rich source to step in.
Come closer. Even your light belongs to me.
lines.speaker: Geisha (Lure)

lines.text: Intruder steps in on the next pluck, and instead of collapsing, the nearest hydrogen people plant their feet and begin a precise synchronized dance.
Contrast can shorten local T1 where flow is abnormal. The earlier we see it, the more options remain.
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: A gadolinium-contrast mark ignites on Intruder's wrist; cyan paths brighten where T1 shortens and reveal a hidden inflow into Geisha (Lure).
Twist beat: Geisha (Lure) sees the mark, her expression cracks into panic, and she freezes as the whole circle stares back.
No... you were supposed to fall with the beat.
lines.speaker: Geisha (Lure)

lines.text: The full Hydrogen Crowd now stands steady, eyes locked on Geisha (Lure), while the castle stops dragging them forward as Intruder calls for early screening.
Do not wait for collapse. If the rhythm keeps breaking, check the brain early with MRI and a specialist.
lines.speaker: Intruder

lines.text: Cut to pure black for a brief held breath.
A katana slash tears across the black in a few seconds, severing the red thread and collapsing the lure silhouette.
